title: Ticket #7569: Fix CA file paths on Debian/Ubuntu
description:
AUTH_SSL_CLIENT_CAFILE and AUTH_SSL_SERVER_CAFILE could (should?) be set by default for OS's/distros where they reside in a well known location.

For EL7, I believe this is /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt

For Ubuntu 16, I believe this is /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt

(Not sure if either of those apply to all RHEL-based and Debian-based distros/versions)
remarks:

Isn't this a duplicate of #7074?

Correct defaults for RHEL and Debian should have been set starting in 8.9.3. Did the wrong ones get picked? Or is this a request for backports?

2020-Mar-29 15:26:41 by tim:
I got the directory right on Debian, but missed the filename change ca-bundle.crt -> ca-certificates.crt.

Also, the default parameters should be correct for stable. So, I am treating this as a bug.
